autumn.lang.compiler

Class Autumn

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.lang.compiler.Autumn

  • public final class Autumn
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class simplifies the use of Autumn.

      • enableDebugger

        public static void enableDebugger()
        This method turns the debug-statements on.

      • disableDebugger

        public static void disableDebugger()
        This method turns the debug-statements off.

      • isDebugOn

        public static boolean isDebugOn()
        This method determines whether the debugger is turned on.
        Returns:
        true, iff the debugger is turned on.

      • enableAssume

        public static void enableAssume()
        This method turns the assume-statements on.

      • disableAssume

        public static void disableAssume()
        This method turns the assume-statements off.

      • isAssumeOn

        public static boolean isAssumeOn()
        This method determines whether assumptions are turned on.

        By default, assume-statements and assert-statements are both on. Only assume-statements (aka assumptions) can be turned off.

        Returns:
        true, iff assumptions are turned on.

      • setErrorReporter

        public void setErrorReporter(IErrorReporter reporter)
        This method sets the error-reporter that is used to report compilation-errors.

        The error-reporter reports parsing-errors, type-checking errors, etc.

        Parameters:
        reporter - is the new error-reporter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if reporter is null.

      • srcDir

        public java.util.List<Module> srcDir(java.io.File root,
                            boolean recur)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method causes source-files to be read, parsed, and added to the list of modules.

        This method skips hidden files and files with extensions other than ".leaf" (ignoring case).

        Parameters:
        root - is the path to the directory containing the source-files.
        recur - is true, if this method should recurse into sub-directories.
        Returns:
        the modules that were successfully parsed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a source-file cannot be read.

      • srcDir

        public java.util.List<Module> srcDir(java.lang.String root,
                            boolean recur)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method causes source-files to be read, parsed, and added to the list of modules.

        Equivalence: srcFile(new File(file))

        Parameters:
        root - is the path to the directory containing the source-files.
        recur - is true, if this method should recurse into sub-directories.
        Returns:
        the modules that were successfully parsed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the source-file cannot be read.

      • srcURL

        public Module srcURL(java.lang.String file)
              throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This method causes a source-file to be read, parsed, and added to the list of modules.

        Equivalence: srcURL(new URL(file))

        Parameters:
        file - is the path to the source-file.
        Returns:
        the Abstract-Syntax-Tree representation of the module.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the source-file cannot be read.
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • src

        public Module src(Module node)
        This method adds the Abstract-Syntax-Tree representation of a module to the list of modules.
        Parameters:
        node - is the AST representation of the module.
        Returns:
        node.

        public CompiledProgram compile()
        This method compiles the list of modules to bytecode.
        Returns:
        the bytecode representation the program.

      • test

        public TestResults test()
        This method compiles the program, dynamically loads it, and then executes the unit-tests contained therein.

        For more information on Autumn unit-tests, see the (autumn.util.test) package.

        Returns:
        the results of running the unit-tests.

      • createProject

        public static void createProject(java.io.File folder,
                 java.lang.String name)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new project folder in a specified directory.
        Parameters:
        folder - is the directory where the new project folder will be created.
        name - is the name of the new project.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name is not a valid name in Autumn.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a folder with the given name already exists.
        java.io.IOException - if name cannot be the name of a folder.
        java.io.IOException - if the project folder cannot be created.

      • loadProject

        public void loadProject(java.io.File folder)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method loads all the source-files and library-files associated with a project.
        Parameters:
        folder - is the path to the project-directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder does not exist.
        java.io.IOException - if the files cannot be read.
